title:
Choropleth Map of Poland
(Area and Population)
text: This is an example of dynamic coropleth maps created in R (RStudio), using the ‘Leaflet’ and ‘ggplot2’ libraries. The maps show the area and population of Poland by voivodeship (province) and selected county (district).

title:
Choropleth Map of Poland
(Area and Population)
text:
Poland. Area and Population


Code
labels <- sprintf(
  "<strong>Poland</strong><br/>the capital: Warszawa 
  <br/>area: %g km<sup>2</sup>
  <br/>population: %gm ", pow_Polski, lud_Polski) %>% 
  lapply(htmltools::HTML)

symbols <- makeSymbolsSize(
  values = woj$znacznik,
  shape = 'circle',
  color = 'yellow',
  fillColor = 'yellow',
  opacity = .7,
  baseSize = 5
)

mapa_Polski <- leaflet(data = Poland) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  setView(lng = 20, lat = 52, zoom = 3.5) %>% 
  addPolygons(data = Poland,
              weight = 1,
              fillOpacity = 0.8,
              fillColor = "#086A87", 
              label = labels,
              labelOptions = labelOptions(
                  style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px"),
                  textsize = "15px", direction = "auto")) %>%
  addMarkers(data = Poland, icon = symbols,  21.03,52.22,2,  popup = "Warszawa") %>%
  addLegend("bottomright", colors = 'yellow', labels = "The capital",
            title = "Warszawa",   opacity = 1, ) 


mapa_Polski








Figure 1: Poland. Area and population

title: Info
text:
Kartogramy Polski na temat powierzchni i ludności województw i wybranych powiatów wykonane w R (RStudio) z wykorzystaniem bibliotek ‘leaflet’ i ‘ggplot2’.
Raport wykonano w Quarto html.
